content: Madhu Sudan – Gordon McKay Professor of Computer Science Harvard John A. Paulson School of Engineering and Applied Sciences Skip to content HARVARD.EDU I am a Professor of Computer Science at Harvard. My research is in the theories of computation and communication. I am very interested in understanding the many ways in which communication or computation can go wrong (i.e., have errors), and how to correct all such errors. My Bulletin Board: • I am teaching a mini-course on coding theory at the Computer Science dept at Bocconi University in Milan. Here’s a doc with more details. For other recent mini-courses on coding theory, see my talks page. • I chaired the Trevisan Prize 2025 search committee. Here’s the announcement of the winners. • I will be on sabbatical in Fall 2025. You can still reach me by email though responses may be delayed if I am traveling. • Of interest to Harvard CS students only: A DGS FAQ related to my past role as Director of grad studies.
